page.title: 06Population Trends
page.content: The population of both East Wemyss and Buckhaven have fluctuated over the years depending on which local industry was flourishing. Today few of the people living in the villages actually work in them. At the start of this century the communities increased in size rapidly with the growth of the coal mining industry. However the recession of the coal industry along with a general structural decline of other traditional industries within the area, such as fishing, the communities have lost much of their vitlity. Many of the younger families have left to seek employment elsewhere while the less economically active members of the community have had little choice but to stay. Many people work at Methil docks and there are still some miners who now travel to Seafield Colliery in Kirkcaldy.
